active_learning.discussion_prompt: In the context of social engineering testing, debate whether it is ethical to use real personal information (with permission) versus fabricated data in simulations. Reference specific tenets from EC-Council and (ISC)² codes to support your position. This encourages critical thinking on confidentiality and deception.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in Penetration Testing and Ethical Hacking. Topic: Industry Code of Ethics (Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Penetration Testing And Ethical Hacking > Social Engineering Testing > 001_Legal, Ethical, and Compliance Considerations > Professional Certifications and Standards > Industry Code of Ethics). Incorporate these elements: - Learning Objectives: [INSERT FULL LIST FROM ABOVE] - Active Learning: [INSERT FULL DETAILS FROM ABOVE] - Scaffolding Layers: [INSERT FULL DETAILS FROM ABOVE] - Sources: (ISC)² Code: https://www.isc2.org/ethics; EC-Council: https://www.eccouncil.org/code-of-ethics/; CREST/CompTIA ethics guidelines. Generate 25 high-quality flashcards using the exact schema: - Balance: 4 REMEMBER, 4 UNDERSTAND, 5 APPLY, 4 ANALYZE, 4 EVALUATE, 4 CREATE. - Cover all 4 scaffolding layers evenly. - For each: Front (question), Back (answer, explanation with Bloom's tie-in and layer reference, MCQ distractors if applicable, active learning link). - Distractors: Follow protocol for misconceptions. - Output as JSON array: [{'type': 'REMEMBER', 'bloom_level': 'REMEMBER', 'layer': 1, 'front': '...', 'back': {'answer': '...', 'explanation': '...', 'distractors': ['A', 'B', 'C'], 'reference': '...'}}] Ensure flashcards promote spaced repetition, active recall, and integration with social engineering ethics. Voter consensus: 100% approval on completeness and pedagogy.
